theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Redox Homeostasis and Antioxidant Defense Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on ROS, antioxidant systems, redox balance, and vitagenes regulating cellular stress responses and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Redox Homeostasis and Antioxidant Defense Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes ROS/RNS roles, protein oxidative modifications, glutathione system, and mitochondrial dysfunction affecting redox balance.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Redox Homeostasis and Antioxidant Defense Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Distinguishes pro-oxidant events from antioxidant decline, focusing on plasma redox couples and redox-sensitive protein modulation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Redox Homeostasis and Antioxidant Defense Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights antioxidant enzymes HO-1 and SOD-2 in brain aging and mitochondrial redox homeostasis.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Redox Homeostasis and Antioxidant Defense Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on glutathione redox state shifts, biosynthesis decline, and oxidative damage accumulation driving aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Redox Homeostasis and Antioxidant Defense Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes balance between pro-oxidative and antioxidative processes, antioxidant enzyme decline, and lipid peroxidation in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Redox Homeostasis and Antioxidant Defense Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Discusses oxidative damage accumulation, antioxidant defense modulation, and environmental influences on oxidative stress and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Redox Homeostasis and Antioxidant Defense Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on oxidative stress-induced molecular damage and declined antioxidant defense in mesenchymal stem cells aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Redox Homeostasis and Antioxidant Defense Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Covers ROS production, oxidative damage accumulation, antioxidant defense, and environmental/genetic interactions in neurodegeneration and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Redox Homeostasis and Antioxidant Defense Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes ROS production, oxidative stress response, and ROS as causal agents of aging in yeast models.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Redox Homeostasis and Antioxidant Defense Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details imbalance of pro-oxidants and antioxidants, multiple ROS sources, and dietary restriction modulation of oxidative stress.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Redox Homeostasis and Antioxidant Defense Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on metallothioneins as antioxidants protecting against oxidative stress and influencing lifespan.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS and Neuromuscular Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes mitochondrial dysfunction, ROS accumulation, and redox imbalance causing neuromuscular junction degeneration and sarcopenia.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS and Neuromuscular Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes mitochondrial ROS generation, oxidative damage accumulation, and age-related changes in antioxidant enzymes in gerbil tissues.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS and Neuromuscular Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on age-related increase in mitochondrial superoxide production and its correlation with lifespan.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS and Neuromuscular Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links mitochondrial dysfunction, ROS production, and stem cell depletion to aging and neurodegeneration.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS and Neuromuscular Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes ROS generation in skeletal muscle, impaired adaptive responses with age, and mitochondrial ROS involvement.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS and Neuromuscular Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Relates metabolic rate, ROS production, and antioxidant enzyme activity to longevity and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS and Neuromuscular Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights p66Shc gene regulating mitochondrial ROS and lifespan, linking oxidative stress to behavioral aging phenotypes.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS and Neuromuscular Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial ROS production, mtDNA mutations, and inflammation disrupting cellular signaling in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS and Neuromuscular Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes oxidative damage as causal, antioxidant defense, and correlation of oxidative stress resistance with longevity.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS and Neuromuscular Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Discusses oxygen's dual role, oxidative stress in aging, hypoxia effects, and metabolic rate association with aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidative Damage and Protein Carbonylation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on ROS causing protein carbonyl accumulation as a marker and causal factor in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidative Damage and Protein Carbonylation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes protein carbonyl accumulation and genetic regulation of oxidative damage influencing lifespan.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidative Damage and Protein Carbonylation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details protein oxidation, carbonylation, nitration, and selective vulnerability contributing to aging and neurodegeneration.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidative Damage and Protein Carbonylation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Explains oxidative stress causing protein misfolding, aggregation, and selective oxidation of calcium regulatory proteins.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidative Damage and Protein Carbonylation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on carbonyl modifications driving protein aggregation and proteostasis decline during aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidative Damage and Protein Carbonylation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links oxidative stress-induced single-strand breaks accelerating telomere shortening and replicative senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidation-Inflammation and Immune Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Integrates chronic oxidative stress and inflammation affecting immune system function and systemic aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidation-Inflammation and Immune Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes mitochondrial ROS, oxidative damage, antioxidant imbalance, and links to inflamm-aging and immunosenescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidation-Inflammation and Immune Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on cardiac oxidative stress activating stress signaling pathways leading to myocardial dysfunction.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidation-Inflammation and Immune Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details brain oxidative stress, lipid peroxidation, neuroinflammation, and impaired damage repair in neurodegeneration.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidation-Inflammation and Immune Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes SKN-1/Nrf regulation of detoxification genes, stress responses, and longevity via oxidative stress protection.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitohormesis and Adaptive Stress Response Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Proposes mild mitochondrial stress induces adaptive responses enhancing antioxidant defenses and lifespan.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitohormesis and Adaptive Stress Response Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes mitochondrial stress activating UPRMT and hormetic pathways via ROS signaling to extend lifespan.
